Item Description: Ninety-six ROTC band members, wearing new uniforms will lead the parade on Band Day. The article describes the Band Day performance and songs under "Billy" Quick's leadership.

Title: "Billy" Quick Reminisces on 19 Happy Years as Band Director
Item Description: A brief article about Quick's career discusses his experience prior to and during his time leading the band.

Title: Husker-Sooner Tilt to Feature 38 Prep Bands at Halftime
Item Description: Special performances for Band Day and Dad's Day include bands from Nebraska and Iowa communities.

Item Description: The article discusses the role and appearance of baton twirlers and the drum major.

Title: Thousands Flood Campus for the Weekend: Rally, Presentation of Pep Queen, Dances Lend Excitement
Item Description: A rally will be held at the Union, followed by a parade and dance. The band's halftime performance at the football game will be broadcast coast to coast for the first time.

Title: Lentz Selects Band Men: Marching Tooters Drill Game-Day Formations
Item Description: Director Don Lentz announces varsity band members after tryouts.

Item Description: Director Don Lentz is cutting varsity band from 113 to 98 members. New "West Point" style uniforms are being ordered for twirlers, and popular music will be added to the band's repetoire. An editorial above the article states the band needs improvement.

Title: Uni Rooters Stage Baylor Rally Tonight: Victory Bell Parade, Bonfire Pep Meeting Will Begin at 7 p.m.
Item Description: The band will march in a parade from the Union to the bonfire rally.

Title: Rifles Join in Pitt Rally: Drill Unit Aids Husker Pep in Panther Hunt
Item Description: In an Armistice Day ceremony, the Pershing Rifles will join the varsity band and cheerleaders in a rally and parade before the Nebraska vs. Pitt football game. Another article, "Memorial Service Precedes Game," describes a pregame ceremony to honor students killed in World War I.

Title: Corn Cobs Prepare to Increase Spirit
Item Description: University band will lead procession in the midst of several rallies before the Aggie football game.

Title: Nebraska Students Buy Kansas Tickets
Item Description: Students can purchase football tickets for the upcoming game in Manhattan, Kansas. The band will also be making the trip to play.

Title: Nebraska Squad Shows up Ames in Every Department
Item Description: The band plays at halftime during the Iowa State home game

Title: Hold Rally on Eve of Oklahoma Game
Item Description: The band plays at a rally featuring a quartet, new song, and speeches.

Title: Students Plan Send-Off for Team Thursday
Item Description: The band will play at the Armory before a parade to the Burlington Station, where the football team is leaving for Illinois.

Title: Huskers Meet for Big Rally
Item Description: 1,500 students take part in a rally before the Illinois game. The band led the students in song.

Title: Hartley Will Talk at Rally
Item Description: Former Husker captain speaks at Armory rally. The band will be traveling to Notre Dame for the game.

Title: Plan Send-Off for Cornhuskers
Item Description: The band will lead a crowd in songs as the football team leaves from the train station at 9th and S streets. This follows a rally the previous day.

Title: Party Ticket Sale Is Well Under Way
Item Description: Tickets are being sold for the Homecoming R. O. T. C. Band Ball as a fundraiser for the band to travel to West Point. Downtown businesses are supporting the fundraiser. Herb Fick and his Missouri Quadrangle Colleagians will provide music for the dance.

Title: Giant Rally to be Held Friday Night
Item Description: The band will lead a parade on the eve of Homecoming to the Lincoln hotel where the Missouri football team is staying.

Title: Rally for First Home Game Will Be Held Tonight
Item Description: The band will play at an Armory rally for the Oklahoma game.

Title: Gamma Lambda Elects
Item Description: Elections are held for the honorary band fraternity, Gamma Lambda's, membership. The organization plans to add several more college bands as chapters.

Title: Train Arrival Starts Rally in Manhattan
Item Description: A rally is planned in Manhattan, Kansas, when the train carrying the football team, cheerleaders, band, and fans arrives. They will parade from the downtown district to Gillette hotel, where the football team is staying.

Title: Special from Kansas Coming
Item Description: University of Kansas students are on their way to Lincoln, bringing with them the 92 person band.

Title: K. U. Athletic Director Will Talk At Rally
Item Description: The band will perform at the Homecoming rally, where several members of the University of Kansas's athletic department will be speaking.

Title: Freshmen Lay Plans for Football Rally
Item Description: A freshman rally is being organized at the Armory for the freshmen football team's Missouri game. The band will be performing.

People: Quick, W. T.; Pauley, Carroll R.
Title: U.P. Announces $2.75 Rate for Manhattan Trip
Item Description: The Union Pacific is offering a round trip price of $2.75 for the Scarlet and Cream special to Manhattan, Kansas. The band will be traveling on the special to the game.

Title: Grid-Graph to Help Organize Cheer Section
Item Description: A new device powered by electricity will be used in Lincoln to indicate the position of the football and players in Illinois. The band will be performing at the "Grid-Graph Party" at the Armory.

Title: Cornhuskers Off to Meet Illini Team
Item Description: The band and Innocents leads a four block parade to send the football team off to Illinois.

Title: Student Rally Will Welcome Players Home
Item Description: The football team and band return from West Point at the Burlington depot, where they will be greeted by the student body.

Title: Gigantic Rally Holds Sway at Station Tonight
Item Description: The band will lead a parade from Social Sciences to the Rock Island Station at 20th and O to welcome back the football team from Syracuse.

Title: Dance Ticket Sale is Large
Item Description: The R. O. T. C. band benefit tickets are selling well, and entertainment and food have been arranged for the event. The University of New York football team will be in attendance. The band will perform at the west entrance of the Social Science building to raise awareness and sell additional tickets.

Title: Coaches and Athletes Endorse Sending Band to Seattle Game
Item Description: The student body and football team supports sending part of the band to Seattle for the game on Thanksgiving day. The band will be sponsoring a benefit dance in order to fundraise for this travel.

Title: Last Rally of Year is Friday
Item Description: A torchlight parade will end the football rally season, as the band and cheerleaders lead from the Social Science building to the Hotel Cornhusker.

Title: University Band Will Play at Convocation
Item Description: The band gives its first concert of the season at the Temple for convocation.  The article goes on to mention the success that band alumni have enjoyed playing with orchestras regionally and nationally.

Subjects: Events & Dances; Fundraising & Finance; Uniform & Equipment
Title: Benefit Mixer for Band Huge Success
Item Description: A benefit is held for the band, with music by Leo Beck's orchestra. The band will soon receive new uniforms, modeled after the R. O. T. C. officer uniforms.

Title: Two Thousand Attend Rally
Item Description: The band plays "Cornhusker" at the opening Armory rally of the year, attended by 2,000 students. Freshmen are encouraged to trade their high school sweaters for Nebraska gear.

Title: Rally Planned for Dads and Visitors
Item Description: A parade is planned through downtown Lincoln as a part of the "noise party." Any "visiting Dad" is invited.

Title: Delt-Phi Delt Bell Formerly Reposed in Belfry Tower of Seward Church
Item Description: Research reveals that during their annual summer retreat in 1898, Cadet members stole a bell from a Black church, which has since been passed between fraternity houses.

Title: To Hold Track Rally Tonight
Item Description: The band will play at a rally for the varsity track squad, although there will be no parade.

Title: "700 to Ames" is Aim of Corncobs
Item Description: The Corncobs are selling tickets for a special to Ames for $10.70. The band will be accompanying the football team to Iowa.

Title: Send-Off Rally Scheduled for This Afternoon
Item Description: The band will perform at a rally sending the football team to Pittsburgh. Students will parade from Social Sciences to the Burlington Station.

Title: Plans Started for Breaking of Stadium Ground
Item Description: The band will be performing at a ceremony for the stadium's ground breaking. Many alumni will be present.

Title: Initial Rally for Freshmen to Come Today
Item Description: The band will play for the freshman class's convocation.

Title: Fight for U-N-I' is Theme from New Husker Melody
Item Description: The band will play the new song "Fight Nebraska" by Joyce Ayres and Lamar Burling. The song will be distributed to students so that they might memorize the lyrics for football season.

Title: Students Will Vent Ardor at Monster Rally
Item Description: The band will perform at a Coliseum rally for the Montana game.

Title: Band Plays at Coliseum Today
Item Description: The band and Glee Club will give a concert, free to the public.

Title: Will Hold Rally for Team Today
Item Description: The band will lead a parade at the first rally of the year. They begin at the Armory and travel to the Burlington Station to send off the football team for Illinois.

Title: Send-Off Rally Will Be Friday
Item Description: The band will lead a parade from the Armory to the North-western Depot, where the football players will be leaving for St. Louis.

Title: Rally Starts Team on Way to Pittsburgh
Item Description: The band leads a parade from Social Sciences to 16th and R, then down O to the station to send the foorball team to Chicago.

Subjects: Uniform & Equipment; Audition; Drill; Military; Rehearsal
Title: Initial Drill Reveals Difficulties of Playing in University Cadet Band
Item Description: This article details the beginning stages of this year's cadet band, where 14 new freshmen and sophomores are learning the ropes. The Cadet rules have changed and freshmen must still attend drill for their first semester. The band will add belts and pouches to their uniform.

Title: Rally Friday at Station to Send Team Off
Item Description: The band will lead a rally from The Armory to the station for the football team's trip to St. Louis

Title: Two Color Slings for Flag Bearers
Item Description: The military department will use two new slings to display flags during regimental parades.

Title: Busses Will Go to Missouri U
Item Description: The band may possibly be traveling in a convoy of 20 buses bound for Missouri. Round trip tickets cost $12.

Title: Ames Tickets Go On Sale Monday
Item Description: The band will be traveling to Ames, Iowa. The roundtrip price for the special is $10.70.

Title: Cadet Regiment Is Given Oath of Allegiance
Item Description: 2,000 cadets swear allegiance to the flag. The band performs "The Cornhusker" after the ceremony.

Title: Freshmen Convocation Launched This Morning
Item Description: The freshman class will be iniated in the Armory, with accompaniment from the band.

Title: Annual Barbecue Staged on Field of New Stadium
Item Description: Memorial Stadium hosts a freshman barbecue, at which the band led the new students in chants and cheers.

Subjects: Cheer & Pep; Homecoming; Parade; Other Band
Title: Seating Capacity for Homecoming is Large
Item Description: The dedication of Memorial Stadium and homecoming celebration can host 20,000. The band will lead a large parade from 12th and R to the stadium, followed by the R. O. T. C., U of Kansas Band, and various fans and colleges.

Title: Make Plans for Rally Tonight on Drill Field
Item Description: The band will perform at a rally just north of the Social Sciences building before the Kansas game.

Title: R. O. T. C. Regiment Will March Friday
Item Description: The band and R. O. T. C. will march in the Armistice Day Parade throughout the downtown district until a service is held at St. Paul Church.

Title: Large Rally is Planned for Tonight
Item Description: The band and Corn Cobs will lead a procession from the Coliseum to the Lincoln hotel in advance of the Syracuse game.

Title: Children Enjoy Concerts Given by R.O.T.C. Band Three Times Weekly
Item Description: The band rehearses three times a week at the drill field between 12th and 14th streets. Children frequent these rehearsals, watching, dancing, and imitating the band members.

Title: Band Present at Rally and Game
Item Description: The band will perform in a parade before the Drake game, as well as take part in halftime entertainment. For the first time this year, the band performs the Star Spangled Banner and all members will wear uniforms. In the past, the band has not been able to provide uniforms for all members.

Title: Season's First Rally Proves Big Success
Item Description: The band takes part in the first rally of the year.

Title: New Nebraska Songs
Item Description: Students are encouraged to take the songs "Win! Nebraska!" and "N E B R A S K A" to the evening's rally.

Title: First Outdoor Rally Will be Held Tonight
Item Description: The band will take part in a rally at the Social Sciences building the evening before the Missouri game. On Thursday, the band played at a football practice.

Title: Band Working on Special Exhibition for Husker-Tiger Game Saturday
Item Description: Following the performance of the Drake University band, and given that the R. O. T. C. Band will have the opportunity of performing at halftime, the band is working on special drill. The article has a description of the drill formations, including an N for Nebraska and M for Missouri.

Title: [Untitled]
Item Description: E. A. Wyman is elected drum-sergeant after Cecil Matthews's employment at the Lyric theater interferes with his duties.

Title: Plans Complete for Big Send-Off
Item Description: The band will lead a parade from 12th and R to the Burlington Depot to send the football team to play Notre Dame.

Title: Uni Band Plays at Legion Convention
Item Description: 60 members of the band perform at the American Legion convention in Omaha.

Title: Husker Team Leaves Today for Missouri
Item Description: The band will perform at a mid-day rally for the football team's send off from Burlington Station bound for Missouri.

Title: Grid-Graph in Operation for Illinois Game
Item Description: The game will be broadcast in the Armory via a "grid-graph scoreboard." The band and cheerleaders will perform to accompany the watch party.

Title: Armory to Q Station for Rally
Item Description: The band will lead a parade from the Armory to Burlington Station, where the football team is leaving for Illinois.

Title: Band will go to Notre Dame
Item Description: The band will travel to Notre Dame and to Kansas. A fundraising effort is underway and students are encouraged to contribute for the band's trip. Band members are also asked to fund a portion of the travel expenses.

Title: Football Team Goes to Kansas
Item Description: The university band will travel with the football team to Kansas.

Title: University Band Will Go on Friday Special to Help Trim Jayhawkers
Item Description: 40 bandmembers will travel to Kansas out of the 72 total members after auditions.

Title: Tassels Will Sell Feathers for Band
Item Description: The Tassels are selling scarlet and white "N" feathers for $.25 to raise money for the band's capes and caps. The band will premiere an arrangement of a new Husker pep song.

Title: Rally and Torchlight Parade in Preparation for Gridiron Classic to be Novel Affair
Item Description: The band will lead chants and songs followed by a torchlight parade down 12th to Q, to 16th, to O, then to the Lincoln Hotel at 9th street to greet the Notre Dame team.

Title: Basketball Rally to be Held Friday Morning
Item Description: The band will perform at the Armory to celebrate the basketball team's opening game.

Title: Band Tryouts Will be Conducted Soon
Item Description: The date for band auditions will be announced soon

Title: Need Instructors
Item Description: Advertisement for band and orchestra instructors

Title: Rockne Expects Bitter Contest
Item Description: Notre Dame is predicting a difficult game against the Huskers. The band is expected to play for the Nebraska team's send-off.

Title: Mamouth [Mammoth] Parade for Grid Men's Sendoff
Item Description: The university band will lead an expected 4,000 students to send the football team to the Notre Dame game. The parade will start at 12th and R to O before heading to the Burlington Depot.

Title: Big Parade for Foot-ball Team
Item Description: The article reports on a 2,000 student parade led by the band to send the footbal team to Pittsburgh. The parade wound through Lincoln, from the Armory to 12th and O, to 9th, then to P and the Burlington Station.

Title: Good Program Scheduled for Opening Rally
Item Description: The band will perform at the first football rally of the season. The article impresses upon new students the importance of the rally as "one of the oldest and most important of the Cornhusker traditions."

Title: Nebraska Gridsters Ready for Coyotes
Item Description: The band will perform at the football game against the South Dakota Coyotes.

Subjects: Fundraising & Finance; Events & Dances; Uniform & Equipment; Audition; Drill
Title: Band Mixer Comes Tomorrow Night
Item Description: The band is holding a dance to fundraise for new uniforms. Leo Beck's orchestra will provide music at the Armory event. The article includes updates about the band's auditions and rehearsals, as the band will be learning new songs this year.

Title: All Bandmen
Item Description: All band members who are not registered this semester are asked to return uniforms and books immediately.

Title: Band Men
Item Description: A note for band members to appear in the regimental parade in uniform

Title: Splendid Showing is Made by R.O.T.C. Unit
Item Description: The band performed in a parade and inspection in honor of General Pershing's visit in April. The R.O.T.C. will perform several more parades and reviews the rest of the semester.

Title: Yearlings to Attend First Convocation
Item Description: The freshmen class will attend a convocation in the Armory at which there will be speeches and music performed by the band and Varsity Quartet. The band will also perform outside of the Armory in advance of the convocation.

Title: Will Dedicate New Stadium Next Saturday
Item Description: Memorial Stadium's dedication will be held next Saturday. The band will lead a parade through downtown Lincoln and then enter the stadium for a dedicatory program. Participants include the R.O.T.C., Kansas University band, Kansas fans, and Nebraska staff and students.

Title: Nebraska Makes First Entry on New Page in Her Athletic History
Item Description: The first football game is played in Memorial Stadium, at which the band performs songs such as "There'll Be a Hot Time in the Old Town Tonight."

Title: Sale of Tickets for Ames Starts Monday
Item Description: Tickets are sale for a trip to Ames, Iowa for $11.12. The band and Corncobs will be accompanying the football team to the game.

Title: Bizad Students to Hold Annual Holiday Friday
Item Description: The band will lead a march to celebrate the agriculture campus's holiday, which includes a picnic, baseball game, dinner, and dance.

Title: To Use Fusees for Torches in Parade Friday
Item Description: Students will use railroad fusees (flare light) in a torchlite parade around the business section of Lincoln. The band will perform before the rally.

Title: University Band Picks Cheyney as President
Item Description: The results of the University Band officer elections are published, along with the date of the band banquet.

Title: Uni Band Entertained at Lions Club Banquet
Item Description: The band are guests at the Lions Club at the Lincoln Chamber of Commerce.

Title: Mounted Troops and Air Squadron from Fort Riley Kansas, Will Feature Military Carnival on May 23
Item Description: The band and cadet regiment will take part in a military exhibition at the state fair grounds. Fifty thousand spectators are expected to attend the event, which will include many troops, airplanes, cavalry, and artillery. Visiting military groups and bands will parade through downtown Lincoln before arriving at the fairgrounds.

Title: Military Units Now Completed: R. O. T. C. is Ready for Today's Event
Item Description: Classes will be dismissed early in advance of a large military exhibition at the State Fair Grounds. The R.O.T.C. band will perform a concert.

Title: Football Rally Staged Tonight
Item Description: The 60 person band will perform at the first rally of the year for the Illinois footblal game.

Title: Song and Yell Rallies Held Yesterday
Item Description: The band performs at multiple rallies between classes, with more to follow today.

Title: Nebraska and Illinois Will Clash Tomorrow
Item Description: The band performs at rallies held between classes in advance of the Nebraska v Illinois game.

Title: Finish Plans for Luncheon
Item Description: The band will perform at the women's Cornhusker Luncheon during a short program at the Armory.

Title: Rally Will be Held Outdoors
Item Description: The band will perform at a rally  and parade in advance of the Colgate game. The parade will move from around 12th and R to the Post Office Square and Lincoln Hotel.

Title: Tag Day
Item Description: This notice contains instructions for students fundraising for the band to return their tags to the Social Sciences building today. A banner at the top of the page reads "SEND THE BAND TO NOTRE DAME!"

Title: Band Will Go to Notre Dame
Item Description: Despite a student fundraising drive falling short, the Lincoln business community has promised funding for 40 members of the band to travel to the Notre Dame game.

Title: Major Assigns Cadet Officers
Item Description: Additional cadet officers are assigned to the band.

Title: Hartley Will Talk at Rally
Item Description: A rally will be held for the football team leaving for Notre Dame. The band will also be traveling to the game.

Title: Plan Send-Off for Cornhuskers
Item Description: The band will lead cheers at a rally for the football team leaving for Notre Dame. The rally will take place at the Chicago & Northwestern railway station at 9th and S.

Title: Trip of Nebraska Band to Notre Dame is Most Extensive Yet Taken
Item Description: The article describes the trip that the band recently took to South Bend for the Notre Dame game, along with the fundraising efforts which made the travel to Notre Dame and Kansas this season possible. Donors include the student body, Rotary Club, "city jobbers," Student Council, and the College Book Store.

Title: Huskers to Hold Rally Next Friday
Item Description: The band will make an appearance at the first rally of the year before the football team plays Washington.

Title: Band Will Go on the Air
Item Description: The band performs concerts each Tuesday evening live from the University of Nebraska broadcasting station. It is estimated that 30,000 may tune into these broadcasts.

Title: News Writing Class Will Cover Address
Item Description: Students from Journalism 81 will write articles covering the convocation at St. Paul's Church. They will arrive at the church by marching from campus to the church behind the band.

Title: Will Dismiss Classes for Convocation
Item Description: Classes are dismissed so students may attend convocation at St. Paul Church, where they will hear Raymond B. Fosdick speak. The band will lead a parade from 12th St down to St. Paul's.

Title: Trumpets Will Take Place of Whistles
Item Description: Cadet companies will be outfitted with trumpets and a trumpeter to make calls, replacing whistle signals.

Title: Nebraska Yells
Item Description: The text of yells including: He's-The-Man, No. 1., Locomotive Yell, and 3 Yes Teams.

Title: First Husker Grid Rally is Friday Night
Item Description: The band will perform at the first rally of the year in the Coliseum the evening before the game against Drake.
